translated: Jātaka🔽The Collection of Birth Stories (Jātakas)🔽The Chapter of the Mango Grove
The Birth Story of Sarabha the Deer
“A person should strive,
a wise one should not be disheartened.
I see myself
as I wished, so it has come to be.
A person should strive,
a wise one should not be disheartened.
I see myself
emerged from the water onto dry land.
A person should make an effort,
a wise one should not be disheartened.
I see myself
as I wished, so it has come to be.
A person should make an effort,
a wise one should not be disheartened.
I see myself
emerged from the water onto dry land.

analyzed: dukkha upanītaḥ api naraḥ sa pañño
translated: Even a wise person who has met with suffering
should not cut off hope for the attainment of happiness;

original: Bahū hi phassā ahitā hitā ca,🔽Avitakkitā maccamupabbajanti.
analyzed: bahū hi phassāḥ ahitā hitā ca  a vitakkitāḥ maccam upabbajanti
translated: for many contacts, both harmful and beneficial,🔽come to the one who has not cut off hope.
What is not thought of happens,
what is thought of is destroyed.
For wealth is not made of thoughts,
of a woman or a man.”
“The sarabha deer in the mountain fastness,
which you pursued before,
with a restless mind,
You are living in freedom.
He who rescued you from the depths of hell,
Sarabhā, having made a bridge of his tusks;
Who delivered you from death, who was brought to suffering,

original: Alīnacittaṁ ta migaṁ vadesi”.🔽“Kiṁ tvaṁ nu tattheva tadā ahosi,
analyzed: alīna cittam ta migam vadesi  kim tvam nu tattha iva tadā
translated: You say that the deer was not quick-witted.”
“Were you there at that time, or did someone tell you this?
Are you one who has removed the covering, who sees all?
Is your knowledge, brahmin, of a frightening form?”

analyzed: na ca iva aham tattha tadā
translated: “I was not there at that time,

original: Na cāpi me koci naṁ etadakkhā;
translated: Nor did anyone tell me this.
The wise, O lord of the people, explain the meaning
Of the well-spoken verses at that time.”

original: “Ādāya pattiṁ paraviriyaghātiṁ,🔽Cāpe saraṁ kiṁ vicikicchase tuvaṁ;
analyzed: ādāya pattim para viriya ghāti  cāpe saram kim vicikicchase tuva
translated: “Having taken the arrow that destroys the strength of others,🔽Why do you hesitate with the arrow in your bow?
The arrow is hidden, quickly kill the Sarabha deer,
For this is the king’s food, O best of the wise.”
“I too know this for certain,
The deer is the king’s food, O brahmin.
Remembering what was done before,
Therefore I do not kill the Sarabha deer.”
“This is not a deer, great king,🔽This is a demon, lord of the land;
Having slain him, O queen,
become the lord of the immortals.

original: Sace ca rājā vicikicchase tuvaṁ,🔽Hantuṁ migaṁ sarabhaṁ sahāyakaṁ;
analyzed: sace ca rājā vicikicchase tuva  hantum migam sarabham sahāyaka
translated: But if you doubt, O king,🔽to slay the deer, the Sarabha, your friend;

analyzed: sa putta dāraḥ nara vīra seṭṭha
translated: With your sons, wives, and retinue, O best of men,
you will go to the Vetaraṇi of Yama.”
“I would rather all the people of the country,

analyzed: puttā ca dārā ca sahāya saṅghā
translated: my sons, wives, and retinue of friends;
we would all go to the Vetaraṇi of Yama,

original: Na tveva hañño mama pāṇado yo.🔽Ayaṁ migo kicchagatassa mayhaṁ,
analyzed: na tu eva haññaḥ mama pāṇadaḥ  ayam migaḥ kiccha gatassa mayha
translated: but not slay him who is my life’s support.🔽This deer is my companion in hardship,
my only companion in this terrible wilderness;
remembering such past service,
knowing this, O Great Brahmā, how could I slay him?”
“Be pleased with your friend, live a long time,
enjoy this kingdom, delight in the qualities of Dhamma;
surrounded by your retinue of women,
rejoice in the kingdom like Sakka in the Heaven of the Thirty-three.
Without anger, always with a peaceful mind,
having become a giver to all guests and beggars;
having given and enjoyed according to your ability,
blameless, go to a heavenly state.”
The Sarabha Deer Jātaka is the tenth.
The Thirteenth Section is finished.
The summary:

analyzed: varaamba kuṭhāri sahasavaro  atha raññasmin dūtaka pañcamakaḥ
translated: Varaamba, kuṭhāri, sahaṁsavara,🔽And in the next, a messenger, the fifth;
Then bodhi, akitti, sutakkarinā,

analyzed: atha ruru mi gena paraḥ sarabhaḥ ti
translated: Then rurumigena, and the next sarabha.
